byline.contributor: Patrick Healy contributed reporting from Decorah, Iowa.
byline.original: By JASON HOROWITZ and YAMICHE ALCINDOR

abstract: Vermont Sen Bernie Sanders's presidential campaign is confronting question of whether to launch stronger line of advertising against Hillary Clinton in Iowa, move some say is necessary to win contest there; Sanders has prided himself on running positive, issues-oriented campaign and avoiding mud-slinging common in presidential race.

headline.print_headline: Sanders at a Crossroads: Attack or Stay Positive?
headline.main: Bernie Sanders at a Crossroads: Attack Hillary Clinton or Stay Positive?

snippet: Mr. Sanders, who has prided himself on avoiding a negative campaign, is wrestling with whether to use a tougher line of ads, which some say may be his only path to win Iowa.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Sanders, who has prided himself on avoiding a negative campaign, is wrestling with whether to use a tougher line of ads, which some say may be his only path to win Iowa.
